content.location: Start as for "Rananim". Clip the first bolt of that route and then move left and up the steep face on great holds.

content.description: Slabby start leads to hard crux move getting off a ledge.
content.protection: 10 bolts lead to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Just left of Mabel...start at a thin seam/crack.

content.description: Crux at brief layback to large incuts and pockets after third bolt.  Rananim: the utopian community D.H. Lawrence intended to found in Northern New Mexico (Rananim is hebrew for "Land of Exultation")
content.location: Shares first bolt with Where's Jay off top of large pillar.

climbs.name: People of the Valley
climbs.fa: Bob D, Mike Howard and Joel Tinl

content.description: Start at right of wall. Clipping the fourth bolt is a little tedious. Getting past the third and fourth bolt is the crux.
content.protection: Six clips will get you to a two-bolt anchor.
content.location: Start to the right side of the wall..

content.description: Great climbing with the technical crux low and the redpoint crux up high.
content.protection: Ten clips leads to a two bolt anchor.

content.description: Two crux sections...one on the slab and on the upper headwall. Cool route with great variety.
content.protection:
Nine clips get you to a two bolt anchor.  

Mabel Dodge Lujan (center), Frieda Lawrence and Dorothy Brett. Photo taken c.a. 1930's.
content.location: Three routes right of "El Grito". Start at the obvious bolted slab.

content.description: Stiff boulders start from pilar. 3rd bolt hard clip with sustained climbing to follow.
content.protection: Bolts to 2 bolt anchor with chains.

content.description: “Amazing climbing on iron hard basalt. One of the best routes I have done on basalt in NM. Classic!” Bob D
content.protection: Gear for the handcrack and eight quickdraws.
content.location:
Climb up the obvious crack and move right making a dicey move past a bolt. Fire up steep, iron hard basalt past five more bolts to the anchors.  

  Beautiful route on excellent basalt.

content.description: Protect lower crack with cam, climb through strenuous lieback to stiff finish.  May need additional bolt.
content.protection: Crack low down (#3 cam and maybe a #2 cam) to bolted shallow crack.  May need additional higher bolt.

content.description:
First area Bob D'Antonio and I started when setting this crag in the Spring of 2007.  Mostly sport, some mixed and a few classic trad pieces in sound, clean stone. Expect solitude, which means low traffic and no chalk marks.   

  These are new routes and they might still give up a hold or two so a helmet is recommended.
